Zeldman:
You may not know his name, but he played a huge part in creating the web you take for granted today. And he‚Äôs back‚Äîkind of.
That would be Glenn Davis and the Verevolf site Zeldman‚Äôs talking about. The ‚Ä¶
Verevolf originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

Don‚Äôt you hate it when you load a website or web app, some content displays¬†and then¬†some images load ‚Äî causing content to shift around? That‚Äôs called¬†content reflow¬†and can lead to an incredibly annoying user experience for ‚Ä¶

Improving Icons for UI Elements with Typographic Alignment and Scale originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Improving Icons for UI Elements with Typographic Alignment and Scale

Global styles, a feature of the block themes, is one of my favorite parts of creating block themes. The concept of global style variations in WordPress were introduced in Gutenberg 12.5 which would allow theme authors to create alternate ‚Ä¶
How to Create Style Variations in WordPress 6.0 Block Themes originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
In my last article we saw how CSS background properties allow us to create cool hover effects. This time, we will focus on the CSS text-shadow property to explore even more interesting hovers. You are probably wondering how adding shadow ‚Ä¶
Cool Hover Effects That Use CSS Text Shadow originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Jhey Tompkins
articles.description:

articles.author: Ollie Williams
articles.description:
According to Toshi Omagari, the author of Arcade Game Typography, the world‚Äôs first multi-colored digital font was created in 1982 for a never-released video game called Insector. Multi-colored fonts, sometimes called chromatic type, are still relatively rare on the ‚Ä¶
COLRv1 and CSS font-palette: Web Typography Gets Colorful originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: COLRv1 and CSS font-palette: Web Typography Gets Colorful

articles.description:
By now, you are probably familiar with one or more programming languages. But have you ever wondered how you could create your own programming language? And by that, I mean:
A programming language is any set of rules that convert 
‚Ä¶
Let‚Äôs Create a Tiny Programming Language originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Sunkanmi Fafowora
articles.description:
AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a modern image file format specification for storing images that offer a much more significant file reduction when compared to other formats like JPG, JPEG, PNG, and WebP. Version 1.0.0 of the AVIF specification ‚Ä¶
Useful Tools for Creating AVIF Images originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

How to Serve a Subdomain as a Subdirectory originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.description:
So, you‚Äôve decided to build a blog with Next.js. Like any dev blogger, you‚Äôd like to have code snippets in your posts that are formatted nicely with syntax highlighting. Perhaps you also want to display line numbers in the ‚Ä¶
Syntax Highlighting (and More!) With Prism on a Static Site originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Syntax Highlighting (and More!) With Prism on a Static Site

articles.author: Nick Sypteras
articles.description:
If you‚Äôve spent time looking at open-source repos on¬†GitHub, you‚Äôve probably noticed that most of them use badges in their README files.¬†Take the official React repository,¬†for instance.¬†There are GitHub badges all over the¬†README¬†file that¬†communicate important dynamic info,¬†like the latest released ‚Ä¶
Adding Custom GitHub Badges to Your Repo originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Preethi
articles.description:
In design, reflections are stylized mirror images of objects. Even though they are not as popular as shadows, they have their moments ‚Äî just think about the first time you explored the different font formats in MS Word or PowerPoint: ‚Ä¶
Creating Realistic Reflections With CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Creating Realistic Reflections With CSS

articles.author: Jhey Tompkins
articles.description:
Howdy y‚Äôall! Unless you‚Äôve been living under a rock (and maybe even then), you‚Äôve undoubtedly heard the news that CSS-Tricks, was acquired by DigitalOcean. Congratulations to everyone! ü•≥
As a little hurrah to commemorate the occasion, I wanted to ‚Ä¶

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Greg Dickens)
articles.description: In this article, we will see step-by-step how you can get the best of customization with easy admin by using Ghost as a headless CMS for a Gatsby static site ‚Äî everything for free.
articles.title: The Ultimate Free Solo Blog Setup With Ghost And Gatsby

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Benjamin Ajibade)
articles.description: In this article, Benjamin Ajibade introduces Kubernetes to front-end engineers and explaines why Kubernetes is integral in a production-ready microservice architecture. Some key terms that are important for team collaboration will be discussed and conclude the post with a quick deployment to getting started as a beginner.
articles.title: Kubernetes For Frontend Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask how one man can go from designing websites for local bands to heading up Google Fonts Knowledge. Smashing‚Äôs Vitaly Friedman talks to Elliot Jay Stocks to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 46 With Vitaly Friedman: Who Is Elliot Jay Stocks?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs take a closer look at how you can create your very own WordPress site up and running created and hosted with the Elementor Cloud Website.
articles.title: The Modern Way To Create And Host A WordPress Site

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sean Roberts)
articles.description: What makes the underused `Server-Timing` header uniquely powerful among all other response headers? We‚Äôll rethink the expectation for using it exclusively for timing and see fast solutions for hard-to-solve monitoring challenges.
articles.title: Rethinking Server-Timing As A Critical Monitoring Tool

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Gerry McGovern)
articles.description: We waste so much today. One way of focusing on what truly matters is by identifying Top Tasks for yourself. Learn how to make tough decisions by focusing on the real, quantifiable evidence that will help create a better experience for your users.
articles.title: Top Tasks: To Focus On What Matters You Must De-Focus On What Doesn‚Äôt

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dan Shappir)
articles.description: In this article, Dan Shappir analyzes the performance cost associated with various frameworks and explains the wide variety of framework and platform choices that are currently available to front-end and fullstack developers.
articles.title: How To Use Google CrUX To Analyze And Compare The Performance Of JS Frameworks

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Denis Studennikov)
articles.description: In this article, we will be taking a closer look at a design case study and discuss possible reasons why its customers abandon their online shopping carts and what solutions are recommended in each particular case.
articles.title: How Even Small UX Changes Can Result In An Increase In Conversion (A Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Smart SVG techniques, from generative SVG grids to SVG paths with masks, grainy SVG gradients, cut-out effects and fractional SVG stars. Let‚Äôs look at some magical SVG techniques that you can use right away.
articles.title: Magical SVG Techniques

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: At the end of 2021, the Chrome team shipped some functionality that has the ability to make or break sites meeting the Core Web Vitals. So, let‚Äôs learn a little bit more about the Back/Forward Cache (aka bfcache), and what you can do to test if your website is compatible with it.
articles.title: Performance Game Changer: Browser Back/Forward Cache

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joshua Mauldin)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs explore how to give and receive better feedback when working remotely ‚Äî feedback that is actionable, specific, kind, and that won‚Äôt set you on edge. We‚Äôll start by explaining when feedback sessions don‚Äôt work and how to prevent it.
articles.title: How To Give Effective Feedback Remotely

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stefan Baumgartner)
articles.description: When deploying websites, there‚Äôs rarely a one-size-fits-all solution. Some websites benefit from server-rendered pages, some prefer statically generating content upfront. In this article, Stefan explains how a CMS such as [Storyblok](https://www.storyblok.com/) can help you make your site more resilient without losing the flexibility to deliver time-relevant content.
articles.title: Resilience, Flexibility And Immediacy: Working With Headless Systems

articles.description: How difficult can it be to design a bulletproof language selector? It‚Äôs not as straightforward as one might think. We need to avoid redirects, decouple our language and country presets, allow for overrides, and use non-modal windows. Let‚Äôs dive in!
articles.title: Designing A Better Language Selector

articles.description: Developers often reach for UI frameworks like Bootstrap or Material UI, hoping that they‚Äôll save a bunch of time and quickly build a professional-looking app. Unfortunately, things rarely work out this way. Let‚Äôs talk about it.
articles.title: You Don‚Äôt Need A UI Framework

articles.title: How Partytown Eliminates Website Bloat From Third-Party Scripts

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nathan Smith)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ceara Crawshaw)

articles.title: How to Convert a Value to a Boolean in JavaScript
